greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle T(n,k) read by rows with a minimum number of prime powers A100994 for which the least common multiple of T(n,1),..,T(n,n) is A003418(n).
comment: Checked up to 28th row. The rest of the ones in the table are there for the least common multiple to calculate correctly.
link: Mats Granvik, Oct 13 2007, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..406
formula: T(n,k) = if n<k+k*|A120112(k-1)| then k, else 1 (1<=k<=n).
T(n,k) = if n < A014963(k)*A100994(k) then A100994(k), else 1 (1<=k<=n). - _Mats Granvik_, Jan 21 2008
example: k occurs A133936(k) times in column k. The first rows of the triangle and the least common multiple of the rows are:
maple: A133232 := proc(n) if n < k*(1+abs(A120112(k-1))) then k else 1; end if; end proc:
mathematica: Table[T[n, k], {n, 1, 10}, {k, 1, n}] // Flatten (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Mar 01 2021 *)
results.author: _Mats Granvik_, Oct 13 2007
ext: Indices added to formulas by _R. J. Mathar_, Nov 23 2010
